page.title: 11Landwade Hall, Exning (One)
page.content: The present Landwade Hall was first owned by Mr. Cotton but has been owned by the Gibson family since 1937 when{Lord Glanely}first bought it. Much of the land was used for his race-horses, stabled at Red House Stud, and for farming. Betwen 1940 and 1948, the Womens Royal Air Force occupied the house for the duration of the Second World War. The present Mr. Gibson moved into Landwade Hall in 1955 and renovated much of the house. The estate consists of 2,300 acres used for live-stock and arable land. He grows corn, barley, sugar-beet, wheat, potatoes, peas and beans. His live-stock consists of 110 breeding Hereford /Angus cattle and one bull. He also has a small herd of Guernsey milking cows.
